data.title: Jordanian Princes - Jordanian Princesses, Prince Ghazi Bin Muhammad, Princess Sarvath El Hassan, Prince Hamzah Bin Al Hussein (Paperback)
data.meta_description: Please note that the content of this book primarily consists of articles available from Wikipedia or other free sources online. Pages: 24. Chapters: Jordanian princesses, Prince Ghazi bin Muhammad, Princess Sarvath El Hassan, Prince Hamzah bin Al Hussein, Prince Talal bin Muhammad, Prince Hassan bin Talal, Haya bint Al Hussein, Prince Faisal bin Al Hussein, Dina bint 'Abdu'l-Hamid, Princess Firyal of Jordan, Princess Muna al-Hussein, Prince Hashim bin Al Hussein, Prince Asem bin Al Nayef, Princess Basma bint Talal, Prince Muhammad bin Talal, Raiyah bint Al Hussein, Princess Iman bint Al Hussein, Princess Aisha bint Al Hussein, Princess Alia bint Al Hussein, Princess Badiya bint El Hassan, Hussein bin Al Abdullah, Crown Prince of Jordan, Princess Noor Hamzah, Princess Rym, Prince Rashid bin El Hassan, Princess Zein bint Al Hussein, Princess Sumaya bint El Hassan, Princess Yasmine bint Asem, Princess Rahma bint El Hassan, Princess Ayah bint Al Faisal, Princess Alia Tabba, Princess Sana Asem, Princess Sarah bint Asem, Princess Salha bint Asem, Prince Abdullah bin Ali, Princess Haya bint Al Hamzah, Prince Omar bin Al Faisal, Princess Aisha bint Al Faisal, Firouzeh Vokhshouri, Princess Jalilah bint Ali, Princess Sara bint Al Faisal, Princess Nejla bint Asem, Prince Muhammad bin Al Talal, Prince Abdullah bin Al Ghazi, Prince Naif bin Abdullah I. Excerpt: Prince Ghazi bin Muhammad of Jordan (born October 15, 1966 in Amman, Jordan) is a Jordanian prince, professor of philosophy, and is a direct descendant of the Prophet Muhammad. He is the son of Prince Muhammad bin Talal of Jordan and his first wife, Princess Firyal. He is the grandson of the King Talal of Jordan. Ph.D. ('Alimmayah) in Islamic Philosophy, awarded highest honors on 16 January 2010.Thesis title: Love in the Holy Qur'an. Ph.D. (Cantab.) in Modern and Medieval Languages and Literatures (July 1993)Thesis title: "What is Falling in Love?: A Study of the Literary Archetype of Love." B.A., Comparative Literatu... undefined Books
